Package icap.services.resources.gs

icap services specific resources

See:
          Description

Class Summary
ExtensionManagement Class used to backup/restore configuration
ExtensionPackage Extension Package containing a packaged language for GreasySpoon
HttpMessage Class used to provide HTTP message to native scripts Provides several methods of common use to manipulate content
JavaSpoonScript Extension of GreasySpoon script, in order to support direct Java coding without JSR223 overhead
Scripts must conform to NativeScript skeleton and are compiled and loaded in memory Compiled result is stored on disk but is more or less useless TODO: check if scripts are correctly unloaded from memory after deletion TODO: check if writing compiled class on disk has an interest or working in memory can be enough
Jsr223SpoonScript GreasySpoon script, synchronized with a script file on disk
scripts are updated based on file time stamp provided by the OS
Scripts files must include following header:
==ServerScript==
@name Say Hello!
@status on/off => allow to enable/disable script (enabled by default)
@description Script description
@include regex matching url (i.e: http://www\.google\.com/.* ) and for which script is applied
@include other regexes
@exclude regex matching url (i.e: http://gmail\.google\.com/.* ) and for which script does not apply
==/ServerScript==

Optional supported headers are:
@order 0..n ==> allows to ask this script to be executed in n position
@responsecode 0|2xx|3xx|5xx..
NativeScript Native Script skeleton for Java native scripts
ScriptChecker Test class, used to call written scripts in order to check basic syntax errors Implemented in 2 ways: one for JSR223, and one for java classes Called after each script modification, return ok or detected error NOTE: only code portions that are really called can be checked in that way
SpoonScript GreasySpoon script, synchronized with a script file on disk
scripts are updated based on file timestamp provided by the OS
Scripts files must include following header:
==ServerScript==
@name Say Hello!
@status on/off => allow to enable/disable script (enabled by default)
@description Script description
@include regex matching url (i.e: http://www\.google\.com/.* ) and for which script is applied
@include other regexes
@exclude regex matching url (i.e: http://gmail\.google\.com/.* ) and for which script does not apply
==/ServerScript==

Optional supported headers are:
@order 0..n ==> allows to ask this script to be executed in n position
@responsecode 0|2xx|3xx|5xx..
 

Exception Summary
SpoonScriptException Custom exception used for scripts execution timeout
